newsitem.title: USA: Schweitzer-Mauduit extends fine paper deal.
newsitem.headline: Schweitzer-Mauduit extends fine paper deal.

text.p: Schweitzer-Mauduit International Inc said it and Philip Morris agreed to extend the initial terms of their fine papers supply agreement to June 30, 1999, from December 31, 1998.

The company said it and Philip Morris decided to extend the terms to push one of the agreement's deadline notices back an extra six months -- to June 30, 1997. Terms of the agreement were not disclosed.
The extension is to give both companies more time to agree on changes that will make the agreement renewable for at least one term, Schweitzer-Mauduit said.
